items.name: AudioManager
items.content: # =================================================================== # # Script: AudioManager # # $$COPYRIGHT$$ # # =================================================================== class AudioManager ###* * Manages the audio playback of the game. * * @module gs * @class AudioManager * @memberof gs * @constructor ### constructor: -> ###* * Stores all audio buffers. * @property buffers * @type gs.AudioBuffer[] * @protected ### @audioBuffers = [] ###* * Stores all audio buffers by layer. * @property buffers * @type gs.AudioBuffer[] * @protected ### @audioBuffersByLayer = [] ###* * Stores all audio buffer references for sounds. * @property soundReferences * @type gs.AudioBufferReference[] * @protected ### @soundReferences = {} ###* * Current Music (Layer 0) * @property music * @type Object * @protected ### @music = null ###* * Current music volume. * @property musicVolume * @type number * @protected ### @musicVolume = 100 ###* * Current sound volume. * @property soundVolume * @type number * @protected ### @soundVolume = 100 ###* * Current voice volume. * @property voiceVolume * @type number * @protected ### @voiceVolume = 100 ###* * General music volume * @property generalMusicVolume * @type number * @protected ### @generalMusicVolume = 100 ###* * General sound volume * @property generalSoundVolume * @type number * @protected ### @generalSoundVolume = 100 ###* * General voice volume * @property generalVoiceVolume * @type number * @protected ### @generalVoiceVolume = 100 ###* * Stores audio layer info-data for each layer. * @property audioLayers * @type gs.AudioLayerInfo[] * @protected ### @audioLayers = [] ###* * Restores audio-playback from a specified array of audio layers. * * @method restore * @param {gs.AudioLayerInfo[]} layers - An array of audio layer info objects. ### restore: (layers) -> @audioLayers = layers for layer, i in layers if layer and layer.playing if layer.customData @playMusicRandom(layer, layer.customData.fadeTime, i, layer.customData.playTime, layer.customData.playRange) else @playMusic(layer, layer.fadeInTime, i) ###* * Loads the specified music. * * @method loadMusic * @param {String} name - The name of the music to load. ### loadMusic: (name) -> name = if name? then (name.name || name) else name if name and name.length > 0 ResourceManager.getAudioStream("Audio/Music/#{name}") ###* * Loads the specified sound. * * @method loadSound * @param {String} name - The name of the sound to load. ### loadSound: (name) -> name = if name? then name.name || name else name if name and name.length > 0 ResourceManager.getAudioBuffer("Audio/Sounds/#{name}") ###* * Updates a randomly played audio buffer. * * @method updateRandomAudio * @param {gs.AudioBuffer} buffer - The audio buffer to update. * @protected ### # FIXME: Refactoring necessary. updateRandomAudio: (buffer) -> if buffer.customData.startTimer > 0 buffer.customData.startTimer-- if buffer.customData.startTimer <= 0 buffer.fadeInVolume = 1.0 / (buffer.customData.fadeTime||1) buffer.fadeInTime = buffer.customData.fadeTime||1 buffer.fadeOutTime = buffer.customData.fadeTime||1 buffer.playTime = buffer.customData.playTime.min + Math.random() * (buffer.customData.playTime.max - buffer.customData.playTime.min) currentTime = buffer.currentTime # - buffer.startTime timeLeft = buffer.duration - currentTime buffer.playTime = Math.min(timeLeft * 1000 / 16.6, buffer.playTime) buffer.customData.startTimer = buffer.playTime + buffer.customData.playRange.start + Math.random() * (buffer.customData.playRange.end - buffer.customData.playRange.start) ###* * Updates all audio-buffers depending on the play-type. * * @method updateAudioBuffers * @protected ### updateAudioBuffers: -> for buffer in @audioBuffers if buffer? if buffer.customData.playType == 1 @updateRandomAudio(buffer) if GameManager.settings.bgmVolume != @generalMusicVolume buffer.volume = (@musicVolume * GameManager.settings.bgmVolume / 100) / 100 @generalMusicVolume = GameManager.settings.bgmVolume buffer.update() ###* * Updates all audio-buffers depending on the play-type. * * @method updateAudioBuffers * @protected ### updateGeneralVolume: -> if GameManager.settings.seVolume != @generalSoundVolume or GameManager.settings.voiceVolume != @generalVoiceVolume @generalSoundVolume = GameManager.settings.seVolume @generalVoiceVolume = GameManager.settings.voiceVolume for k of @soundReferences for reference in @soundReferences[k] if reference.voice reference.volume = (@voiceVolume * GameManager.settings.voiceVolume / 100) / 100 else reference.volume = (@soundVolume * GameManager.settings.seVolume / 100) / 100 ###* * Updates the audio-playback. * * @method update ### update: -> @updateAudioBuffers() @updateGeneralVolume() ###* * Changes the current music to the specified one. * * @method changeMusic * @param {Object} music - The music to play. If null the current music will stop playing. ### changeMusic: (music) -> if music? and music.name? if @music? and @music.name != music.name @playMusic(music) else if not @music? @playMusic(music) else @stopMusic() # FIXME: Is this still used? ###* * Prepares. * * @method prepare * @param {Object} music - The music to play. If null the current music will stop playing. ### prepare: (path, volume, rate) -> buffer = ResourceManager.getAudioBuffer(path) if buffer.decoded buffer.volume = if volume? then volume / 100 else 1.0 buffer.playbackRate = if rate? then rate / 100 else 1.0 else buffer.onFinishDecode = (source) => source.volume = if volume? then volume / 100 else 1.0 source.playbackRate = if rate? then rate / 100 else 1.0 buffer.decode() return buffer ###* * Plays an audio resource. * * @method play * @param {String} path - The path to the audio resource. * @param {number} volume - The volume. * @param {number} rate - The playback rate. * @param {number} fadeInTime - The fade-in time in frames. ### play: (path, volume, rate, fadeInTime) -> buffer = ResourceManager.getAudioStream(path) if buffer.decoded buffer.volume = if volume? then volume / 100 else 1.0 buffer.playbackRate = if rate? then rate / 100 else 1.0 buffer.play(fadeInTime) if GameManager.settings.bgmEnabled else buffer.onFinishDecode = (source) => source.volume = if volume? then volume / 100 else 1.0 source.playbackRate = if rate? then rate / 100 else 1.0 source.play(fadeInTime) if GameManager.settings.bgmEnabled buffer.decode() return buffer ###* * Stops all sounds. * * @method stopAllSounds ### stopAllSounds: -> for k of @soundReferences for reference in @soundReferences[k] reference?.stop() ###* * Stops a sound and all references of it. * * @method stopSound * @param {String} name - The name of the sound to stop. ### stopSound: (name) -> if @soundReferences[name]? for reference in @soundReferences[name] reference.stop() ###* * Stops a voice. * * @method stopVoice * @param {String} name - The name of the voice to stop. ### stopVoice: (name) -> @stopSound(name) ###* * Stops all voices. * * @method stopAllVoices ### stopAllVoices: -> for k of @soundReferences for reference in @soundReferences[k] reference.stop() if reference.voice ###* * Plays a voice. * * @method playVoice * @param {String} name - The name of the voice to play. * @param {number} volume - The voice volume. * @param {number} rate - The voice playback rate. ### playVoice: (name, volume, rate) -> voice = null if GameManager.settings.voiceEnabled and not $PARAMS.preview?.settings.voiceDisabled voice = @playSound(name?.name, volume || GameManager.defaults.audio.voiceVolume, rate || GameManager.defaults.audio.voicePlaybackRate, no, yes) return voice ###* * Plays a sound. * * @method playSound * @param {String} name - The name of the sound to play. * @param {number} volume - The sound's volume. * @param {number} rate - The sound's playback rate. * @param {boolean} musicEffect - Indicates if the sound should be played as a music effect. In that case, the current music * at audio-layer will be paused until the sound finishes playing. * @param {boolean} voice - Indicates if the sound should be handled as a voice. ### playSound: (name, volume, rate, musicEffect, voice) -> if $PARAMS.preview?.settings.soundDisabled then return if not name? or (!voice and !GameManager.settings.soundEnabled) then return if name.name? volume = name.volume rate = name.playbackRate name = name.name if name.length == 0 then return if musicEffect @stopMusic() if not @soundReferences[name]? @soundReferences[name] = [] volume = volume ? 100 volume *= if voice then @generalVoiceVolume / 100 else @generalSoundVolume / 100 reference = null for r in @soundReferences[name] if not r.isPlaying reference = r if musicEffect then reference.onEnd = => @resumeMusic(40) reference.voice = voice reference.volume = volume / 100 reference.playbackRate = rate / 100 @voice = reference if voice reference.play() break if not reference? buffer = ResourceManager.getAudioBuffer("Audio/Sounds/#{name}") if buffer and buffer.loaded if buffer.decoded reference = new GS.AudioBufferReference(buffer, voice) if musicEffect then reference.onEnd = => @resumeMusic(40) reference.volume = volume / 100 reference.playbackRate = rate / 100 reference.voice = voice reference.play() @voice = reference if voice @soundReferences[name].push(reference) else buffer.name = name buffer.onDecodeFinish = (source) => reference = new GS.AudioBufferReference(source, voice) if musicEffect then reference.onEnd = => @resumeMusic(40) reference.voice = voice reference.volume = volume / 100 reference.playbackRate = rate / 100 @voice = reference if voice reference.play() @soundReferences[source.name].push(reference) buffer.decode() return reference ###* * Plays a music as a random music. A random music will fade-in and fade-out * at random times. That can be combined with other audio-layers to create a * much better looping of an audio track. * * @method playMusicRandom * @param {Object} music - The music to play. * @param {number} fadeTime - The time for a single fade-in/out in frames. * @param {number} layer - The audio layer to use. * @param {gs.Range} playTime - Play-Time range like 10s to 30s. * @param {gs.Range} playRange - Play-Range. ### playMusicRandom: (music, fadeTime, layer, playTime, playRange) -> return if $PARAMS.preview?.settings.musicDisabled layer = layer ? 0 volume = if music.volume? then music.volume else 100 volume = volume * (@generalMusicVolume / 100) @musicVolume = volume @disposeMusic(layer) if music.name? and music.name.length > 0 musicBuffer = @play("Audio/Music/#{music.name}", volume, music.rate) musicBuffer.loop = yes musicBuffer.volume = 0 musicBuffer.duration = Math.round(musicBuffer.duration * 1000 / 16.6) musicBuffer.customData.playType = 1 musicBuffer.customData.playTime = playTime if playRange.end == 0 musicBuffer.customData.playRange = { start: playRange.start, end: musicBuffer.duration } else musicBuffer.customData.playRange = playRange musicBuffer.customData.fadeTime = fadeTime musicBuffer.customData.startTimer = Math.round(musicBuffer.customData.playRange.start + Math.random() * (musicBuffer.customData.playRange.end - musicBuffer.customData.playRange.start)) @audioBuffers.push(musicBuffer) if not @audioBuffers.contains(musicBuffer) @audioBuffersByLayer[layer] = musicBuffer @audioLayers[layer] = name: music.name, time: music.currentTime, volume: music.volume, rate: music.playbackRate, fadeInTime: fadeTime, customData: musicBuffer.customData ###* * Plays a music. * * @method playMusic * @param {string|Object} name - The music to play. Can be just a name or a music data-object. * @param {number} volume - The music's volume in percent. * @param {number} rate - The music's playback rate in percent. * @param {number} fadeInTime - The fade-in time. * @param {number} layer - The layer to play the music on. ### playMusic: (name, volume, rate, fadeInTime, layer) -> return if $PARAMS.preview?.settings.musicDisabled if name? and name.name? layer = if layer? then layer else rate || 0 fadeInTime = volume volume = name.volume rate = name.playbackRate name = name.name else layer = layer ? 0 @disposeMusic(layer) @audioLayers[layer] = name: name, volume: volume, rate: rate, fadeInTime: fadeInTime, playing: true volume = if volume? then volume else 100 volume = volume * (@generalMusicVolume / 100) @musicVolume = volume if name? and name.length > 0 @music = name: name musicBuffer = @play("Audio/Music/#{name}", volume, rate, fadeInTime) musicBuffer.loop = yes @audioBuffers.push(musicBuffer) if not @audioBuffers.contains(musicBuffer) @audioBuffersByLayer[layer] = musicBuffer ###* * Resumes a paused music. * * @method resumeMusic * @param {number} fadeInTime - The fade-in time in frames. * @param {number} layer - The audio layer to resume. ### resumeMusic: (fadeInTime, layer) -> layer = layer ? 0 if @audioBuffersByLayer[layer]? and not @audioBuffersByLayer[layer].isPlaying @audioBuffersByLayer[layer].resume(fadeInTime) @audioLayers[layer]?.playing = true ###* * Stops a music. * * @method stopMusic * @param {number} fadeOutTime - The fade-out time in frames. * @param {number} layer - The audio layer to stop. ### stopMusic: (fadeOutTime, layer) -> layer = layer ? 0 @audioBuffersByLayer[layer]?.stop(fadeOutTime) @audioBuffersByLayer[layer]?.customData = {} @audioLayers[layer]?.playing = false @music = null ###* * Stops all music/audio layers. * * @method stopAllMusic * @param {number} fadeOutTime - The fade-out time in frames. ### stopAllMusic: (fadeOutTime) -> for buffer in @audioBuffers if buffer? buffer.stop(fadeOutTime) buffer.customData = {} @music = null dispose: (context) -> data = context.resources.select (r) -> r.data for buffer, layer in @audioBuffersByLayer if buffer and data.indexOf(buffer) != -1 buffer.dispose() @audioBuffers.remove(buffer) @audioBuffersByLayer[layer] = null @audioLayers[layer] = null ###* * Disposes a music. * * @method disposeMusic * @param {number} layer - The audio layer of the music to dispose. ### disposeMusic: (layer) -> layer = layer ? 0 @stopMusic(0, layer) #@audioBuffers[layer]?.dispose() @audioBuffers.remove(@audioBuffersByLayer[layer]) @audioBuffersByLayer[layer] = null @audioLayers[layer] = null window.AudioManager = new AudioManager() gs.AudioManager = AudioManager
